oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Social & civic facilities; Women; Older people; Quilts
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Elizabethton Senior Citizen Center. Unidentified women can be seen quilting and holding up samples of other quilts.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: TSLA Staff
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The quilting bee became a tradition probably during the 19th Century. Many bees were simply an occasion wherein women assisted one another in finishing quilts. They eventually became an opportunity for women to gather in a social environment. The bee itself often featured a large wooden frame around which many women would work on the same quilt.
